tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 258 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through removal spells and graveyard hate. It also aims to generate card advantage and gain incremental value through cards like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas. The deck can also create tokens with Khalni Garden and utilize them for various benefits. Additionally, it includes a small reanimation package with cards like Pulse of Murasa and Avenging Hunter to bring back key creatures. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while maintaining board control.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Balustrade Spy combo by using cards like Land Grant and Winding Way to dig for combo pieces. The combo involves milling your entire library with Balustrade Spy's ability, putting Dread Return in the graveyard to reanimate Lotleth Giant, which then deals damage equal to the number of creatures milled, leading to a potential one-shot kill. The deck also includes supporting cards like Priest of Titania and Timberwatch Elf to generate mana and pump creatures, respectively.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage as quickly as possible. The goal is to use efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, along with powerful creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary, to bring the opponent's life total down rapidly. The deck also includes cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Clockwork Percussionist to further boost the damage output. By combining creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and utilizing disruption spells to control the board and tempo of the game. By deploying threats quickly and efficiently, combined with counterspells and removal options, the deck can put pressure on the opponent while keeping their own resources protected. The addition of card draw spells helps to maintain a steady stream of threats and answers, while the inclusion of Ninjas provides additional card advantage and tempo swings. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through countering spells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Cast Down and Snuff Out, while also utilizing counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce to deny the opponent's key plays. The deck also includes card draw effects like Brainstorm and The Modern Age to maintain card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes threats like LÃ³rien Revealed and Gurmag Angler to close out the game. The mana base is mainly composed of Islands, with some utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Contaminated Aquifer to support the strategy.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's board through a combination of low-cost removal spells and counterspells. The deck also includes card draw options to ensure consistency and maintain hand advantage. The inclusion of creatures like Sneaky Snacker and Gurmag Angler provides a win condition, while Tolarian Terror can help control the opponent's hand size. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that allow for recurring value and card advantage. This deck focuses on using Ephemerate to blink key creatures like Sea Gate Oracle and Archaeomancer, along with spells like Ghostly Flicker and Mulldrifter. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by maximizing card draw and manipulating the battlefield in your favor. This deck also includes counterspells like Remove Soul and Prohibit to protect your board state. The mana base includes bounce lands and utility lands to help with resource management.

The main theme of the deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on dealing damage efficiently and quickly, utilizing low-cost creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Kitchen Imp, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper. It also includes cards for card advantage and life gain to maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is a mix of Rakdos-colored lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to efficiently mill the entire library, using cards like Balustrade Spy and Dread Return. This is achieved by generating a large amount of mana through defenders like Overgrown Battlement and Axebane Guardian, while also utilizing cards like Saruli Caretaker and Quirion Ranger for additional ramp and utility. The deck aims to win by either overwhelming the opponent with a massive board presence or by reanimating a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant for a game-winning finish.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient ramp spells. By utilizing cards like Wild Growth, Utopia Sprawl, Arbor Elf, and Nyxborn Hydra, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early in the game and maintain pressure with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Malevolent Rumble. With a mix of resilient creatures like Avenging Hunter and Bannerhide Krushok, along with evasive threats like Jewel Thief and Sagu Wildling, the deck aims to close out games quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of creature attacks and direct burn spells. By utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help to filter through the deck, while Highway Robbery provides additional reach to finish off opponents. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and aggression to overwhelm opponents in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

This aggro-burn deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of cheap creatures like Sneaky Snacker and Kessig Flamebreather, alongside direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Fiery Temper. The deck also includes cards like Guttersnipe and Fireblast to increase the burn damage output. Faithless Looting helps with card selection and Grab the Prize provides additional resources. Highway Robbery can help close out the game by stealing the opponent's cards. The deck's strength lies in its ability to consistently apply pressure and finish off opponents swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and artifact cards to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It includes cards that allow for recurring creatures from the graveyard, as well as cards that provide additional value through sacrificing or returning creatures to hand. The mana base is setup to ensure a steady flow of both white and black mana to support the aggressive playstyle. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and maintain pressure throughout the match.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature tactics and combat tricks. By utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures and combat tricks, the deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a solid mana base and a focus on creature synergy, this Orzhov Aggro deck aims to outpace and overpower the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells from the Rakdos color combination. This aggressive strategy is supported by cards like Voldaren Epicure, Sneaky Snacker, and Lightning Bolt to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize provide card advantage and help maintain momentum. Additionally, cards like Vampire's Kiss and Alms of the Vein provide extra reach and help to stabilize against aggressive decks. This deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through a combination of creature damage and burn spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back to the battlefield using cards like Exhume and Dread Return. The deck also includes cards to protect and control the game, such as Counterspell and Cast Down. By utilizing spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to set up the perfect combination of cards to execute its reanimation strategy. With a mix of control elements and graveyard synergy, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game.
